title: Macbook A2338 Water Damage
message:
Hello,
I have a Macbook Pro that came in for no touch bar.
The board had corosion but no shorts.
Cleaned up the board and put it back.

Checked with another chasis to confirm that it is a faulty touch bar issue.

But the machine as a weird problem with the sleep sensor. If we put the flap down, the light doesnt go off. And then if we put the flap back up the machine hangs - the cursor moves and presses but the apps are unresponsive.

title: Macbook A2338 Water Damage
message:
I bet you have corroded lid angle sensors.
Check JR200/1 and UR200 signals.

If you need to replace any, watch this:
[MEDIA=youtube]Lxo6l_whDeE[/MEDIA]

title: Macbook A2338 Water Damage
message:
Checked with just the board on the table.

AMR_RIGHT_OR_ND_1V8 IS 0.9V
AMR_LEFT_OR_ND_1V8
IPD_LID_OPEN_R_1V8 IS 1.8V

title: Macbook A2338 Water Damage
message: AMR_RIGHT_OR_ND_1V8 must be high, if JR201 is not connected; unless RR201 is bad.

title: Macbook A2338 Water Damage
message:
DIODE MODE READINGS on RR2201

Pin #1 is .290
Pin #2 is .400

Getting 1.8V on Pin 1 and 0.9V on Pin 2

title: Macbook A2338 Water Damage
message: Replaces RR201 but its still the same.

title: Macbook A2338 Water Damage
message: You mean to remove the connector from the board - JR900 ?

title: Macbook A2338 Water Damage
message:
The connector from the board???
Why not disconnect the audio flex only?

title: Macbook A2338 Water Damage
message: Its just the raw board that i am testing. The Audio board and flex isn’t connected. The above readings are of the main board.

title: Macbook A2338 Water Damage
message:
Something pulls down the signal.
May have corrosion under JR900, UR200, or M1 chip.

Try forcing the signal with 100-10K, instead of 1M (in place of RR201).

title: Macbook A2338 Water Damage
message: Amazing !! Its working fine now. Even the touchbar is back on. This is crazyyyyy.
